newsitem.title: USA: Lucent to sell equipment to NextWave - WSJ.
newsitem.headline: Lucent to sell equipment to NextWave - WSJ.

text.p: Wireless company NextWave Telecom Inc has agreed to purchase $200 million in equipment during the next two years from Lucent Technologies Inc, the Wall Street Journal reported on Monday.
The newspaper said NextWave, whose purchase it to be announced on Monday, might buy another $800 million from Lucent later.
The company plans to offer a digital-wireless service called personal communication service to compete against traditional cellular, it said.
The newspaper said Lucent has agreed to finance the initial $200 million of equipment for NextWave's Northeast markets like New York and Boston.
